text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify that appeals from the CIT (US Court of International Trade) are taken to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit (CAFC). The entire scenario and the candidate answer focus exclusively on UK customs, HMRC, UK VAT, and EU/UK trade regulations following a change in Incoterms (from DDP/DAP implied to EXW) due to a UK retailer acquisition by a US conglomerate. There is no mention or discussion of the US Court of International Trade (CIT) or the CAFC, as the legal jurisdiction discussed is entirely UK/EU.", "criterion_id": "aaf4f6c2-3c20-4a22-af29-fa821d6167b4"}
